result.execSummary:
All charges against Tyler Keith Julian Boutin in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler Keith Julian Boutin is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Keith Julian Boutin

records.addlTxt: Moved $250 to Atty Fee invoice on 21CF853. sf
atty fees. $710.00. Includes 21CF853, 22CF249, and 22CF298. Filed by Atty Skatrud. arc   to SJN

10:05 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud, DF: Tyler Keith Julian Boutin appeared. INCLUDES 21CF853, 22CF249 and 22CF298. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. DE sworn. Court amends Ct 1 in 21CF853 to remove modifier. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 - Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) WITHOUT modifier in 21CF853. 22CF249 (WOPH): Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 - Felony Bail Jumping in 22CF249. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 - Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) in 21CF853 and Ct 2 - Felony Bail Jumping in 22CF249. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 2-4 in 21CF853 and case 22CF298 in it's entirety. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 10:36 AM. kma

Court orders:
21CF853
Ct 1 - Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) 
S/W 1 year probation with conditions:
- 30 days conditional jail - STAYED
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court

22CF249
Ct 2 - Felony Bail Jumping
S/W 1 year probation with conditions:
- 30 days conditional jail - STAYED; concurrent to 21CF853
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample; no surcharge ordered

Payment plan approved to continue.
Defendant to report to probation no later than today, 6/9/22 at 4:00 pm.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

for continuance of 5/13 PH. Filed by Atty Skatrud. km
Per EFV on 5-12-2022: "Okay to reschedule" JA will reset w/ Attys. rg/km
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:30 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Ryan A. Shervey   DF:  Tyler Keith Julian Boutin appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE has hired private counsel. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
